title: Honeybee

verbs: Travel through the air; be airborne
To cause to travel through the air.
To cause to fly : to transport via air or the like.
To move autonomously through the air, without any part of the object or object's enclosure touching anything attached to the ground.
nouns: Insects are a class of invertebrates within the arthropod phylum that have a chitinous exoskeleton, a three-part body, three pairs of jointed legs, compound eyes and one pair of antennae.
A class of the Arthropoda typically having a segmented body with an external chitinous covering, a pair of compound eyes, a pair of antennae, three pairs of mouthparts, and two pairs of wings.
An arthropod in the class Insecta, characterized by six legs, up to four wings, and a chitinous exoskeleton.
Arthropod of class insecta.
Small air-breathing arthropod
Class of invertebrates within the arthropod phylum
A flying insect of the genus Bombus.
A bumblebee, also written bumble bee, is any member of the bee genus Bombus, in the family Apidae.
Any of several species of large bee in the genus Bombus.
Robust hairy social bee of temperate regions
Any member of the bee genus Bombus, in the family Apidae
Genus of bee.
¬† Traditionally the first of the four seasons of the year in temperate regions, in which plants spring from the ground and trees come into blossom, following winter and preceding summer.
The season of growth
The season of spring.
Season, between winter and summer
One of the four temperate seasons
The season of spring, between winter and summer.
Traditionally the first of the four seasons, the season of growth with an ever increasing amount of daytime.
Spring is one of the four conventional temperate seasons, following winter and preceding summer.
Spring is one of the four seasons of temperate zones, the transition from winter into summer.
Any of numerous hairy-bodied insects including social and solitary species
A flying insect, of the superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies and for collecting pollen and producing wax and honey.
Bees are flying insects closely related to wasps and ants, and are known for their role in pollination and for producing honey and beeswax.
Flying insects closely related to wasps and ants. monophyletic lineage within the superfamily Apoidea, presently classified by the unranked taxon name Anthophila.
Any of the membranous-winged insects which compose the superfamily Apoidea in the order Hymenoptera characterized by a hairy body and by sucking and chewing mouthparts.
Honey is a sweet food made by bees using nectar from flowers.
A viscous, sweet substance produced from nectar or honeydew by bees.
Sweet food made by bees using nectar from flowers
A pure form of honey
Sweet substance produced by bees.
A viscous, sweet fluid produced from plant nectar by bees. Often used to sweeten tea or to spread on baked goods.
A sweet yellow liquid produced by bees
Any bee of the genus Apis
Species of honey bee
Any of seven species of bee, in genus Apis, often kept commercially for honey, beeswax, and pollination of crops.
Social bee often domesticated for the honey it produces
The western honey bee or European honey bee is a species of honey bee.
A stinging, social, domesticated insect (Apis mellifera) kept by humans for the creation of beeswax and honey.
A honey bees is any member of the genus Apis, primarily distinguished by the production and storage of honey and the construction of perennial, colonial nests from wax.
General term for any insect or similar creeping or crawling invertebrate

description:
A honey bee, a busy, flying insect that lives in a hive and makes honey. Depicted as a black-and-yellow bee with clear or white wings and a stinger. Variously facing left in full profile or shown from above.

May be used to represent various types of bees (e.g., bumblebee) and wasps (e.g., hornets, yellow jackets). May also be used to accent black-and-yellow colors or patterns. Popularly used in connection with singer and superstar Beyoncé (nicknamed Queen Bey) or for metaphorical queen bees. Can also be used to refer to the city of Manchester in the United Kingdom, as the worker bee is the symbol of the city.
apple_vendor_description: The honeybee emoji on Apple devices is a charming and meticulously crafted insect, buzzing with life. Its body is rendered with a delightful combination of yellow and black stripes, highlighted by Apple‚Äôs signature glossy 3D shading that gives it a plump, tactile appearance. The delicate wings catch the light, appearing almost translucent, a testament to Apple's realistic lighting techniques. This emoji often symbolizes hard work, diligence, sweetness, and the vital role of nature, bringing a touch of the natural world to digital messages.
